messages: 9cc307fbee8c01c6ca122eeaf3983a86 (01:30): /dev/null")
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:38): god i need a new job
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (01:40): I'm trying to figure out menubars
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (01:40): how do I make a menu item that opens one of my dialogs?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:42): when you create a menu item, you are creating a qaction
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:42): you connect to the qaction's triggered() slot
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:42): !rtfm action
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (01:42): nuge: QAction (Qt 4.1) http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qaction.html
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:43): you might make your own custom slot that does stuff.. or you could connect it to a slot on your dialog, like exec() or whatever
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (01:43): I'm looking at that.  How do I make it open a dialog though?  I guess this question is unrelated to the menu
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (01:43): exec?  okay
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (01:47): do QActions need parents?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:53): yes, i think they do, but why do you need to know that? your menu item is a qaction already
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:53): so you don't have to manually create a qaction
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (01:58): I don't?  uh...  I thought that would be easier, because I don't know where it would tie my signals otherwise
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:00): you would tie it in your code
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:00): you can get the name of the object by looking at the action editor
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:00): action editor?
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:01): you mean in designer?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:01): if you added a menu item named 'asdf', then the action is probably named 'actionAsdf'
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:01): you're not using designer for htis?
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:01): no, I'm just typing in the C code
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:01): should I be using designer?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:01): ok that's fine too.. then ignore what i said before
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:01): Does it generate C++?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:01): doesn't matter
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:02): but don't change now
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:02): if you're using code.. i would just use the handy QMenu::addAction() methods
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (02:02): nuge: QMenu (Qt 4.1) http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qmenu.html
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:03): then you get a pointer to the created action, and you can connect the triggered() signal to whatever you want
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:03): yeah..  but I don't understand what signal/slot that's tied to
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:03): oh, I thought addAction gave it a default slot
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:03): the returned pointer is a pointer to the QAction it created for you
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:03): I know
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:03): QAction *myAction = myMenu->addAction("whatever");
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:04): connect(myAction, SIGNAL(triggered()), myDialog, SLOT(exec()));
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:04): um, okay
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:05): you don't know how signals/slots work?
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:06): oh woot, it works
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:06): I didn't realize exec was a slot
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:06): you mean you didn't rtfm on QDialog
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:07): and I thought I was supposed to create a specific slot for the QAction to be happy
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:09): nuge: rtfm happy today, are we?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (02:11): germany-italy 0-0 still
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:23): okay maybe you can help me with something a little more design oriented

aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:24): so if I have a main window, and dialogs that function on it, and I have separate classes for the data, where should these classes be instantiated and how can I give a dialog access to it?
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:25): for example, if I had a class that handled network actions toward a server, and I had a dialog that allowed you to tell it how to connect to that server...
aab267d05db3d6ad5843d69de13bc4c9 (02:29): if I just tied these data classes to the main window, I'm not sure how my dialogs that were just "exec'd" would be able to access methods from it
